info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 4:21AM MDT until September 13 at 6:15AM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southwestern Sierra County in southern New Mexico.
* WHEN...Until 615 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 421 AM MDT, Showers and thunderstorms with brief heavy rainfall are moving back into the Lake Valley area, which has already received over an inch of rain since yesterday. Storms are lined up to the southwest, and look to train over the same area in the next 1 to 2 hours. This will likely lead to inundation of low water crossings along Highway 27. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lake Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM MDT THIS MORNING
